headline: JPMorgan earnings, December CPI, Trump comments: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Brooke DiPalma previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Tuesday, January 13, including quarterly earnings results from JPMorgan Chase (JPM), the Bank of NY Mellon (BK), and Delta Air Lines (DAL); the latest inflation reading from December's Consumer Price Index (CPI) report; new home sales data; and President Trump's speech at the Detroit Economic Club at 2 P.M. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Bank sector is hitting this 'trifecta,' set to outperform S&P 500
summary: Earnings season starts for major banks JPMorgan Chase (JPM), Bank of America (BAC), Citigroup (C), Morgan Stanley (MS), Wells Fargo (WFC), and Goldman Sachs (GS) this week, all of these major financial stocks set to report fourth quarter earnings results throughout the week. RBC Capital Markets analyst Gerard Cassidy shares his perspective on the KBW Bank ETF (KBWB) outperforming the S&P 500 (^GSPC), while also discussing his outlook for regional bank stocks Fifth Third Bancorp (FITB) and M&T Bank (MTB). Also hear Gerard Cassidy explain why President Trump's suggested 10% cap on credit card rates would have "real negative repercussions" for borrowers. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: These Stocks Are Today’s Movers: JPMorgan, Delta, L3Harris, Intel, AMD, BNY Mellon, and More
summary: Stock futures were falling Tuesday as investors digested quarterly results from  JPMorgan Chase  and  Delta Air Lines  both of which kicked off the earnings season.  JPMorgan Chase  rose 0.4%.  Although the bank’s profit declined 7% in the fourth quarter, revenue rose on the back of higher fees and interest income.

headline: BNY Mellon Earnings Top Expectations. Why the Stock Is Falling.
summary: Bank of New York Mellon  declined Tuesday after the company beat quarterly earnings expectations but projected a slowdown in growth in 2026.  The bank reported adjusted earnings of $2.08 a share for the fourth quarter, surpassing analysts’ consensus estimate of $1.99, according to FactSet.  BNY Mellon shares fell 2.7% in premarket trading Tuesday.

content.title: BNY Mellon Earnings Top Expectations. Why the Stock Is Falling.

The bank reported adjusted earnings of $2.08 a share for the fourth quarter, surpassing analysts’ consensus estimate of $1.99, according to FactSet.  BNY Mellon shares fell 2.7% in premarket trading Tuesday.

headline: BNY (NYSE:BK) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q4 CY2025
summary: Global financial services company BNY NYSE:BK) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 6.8% year on year to $5.18 billion. Its GAAP profit of $2.02 per share was 6.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Fed expected to 'stick to the mandate' amid DOJ investigation
summary: President Trump's Department of Justice (DOJ) has launched a criminal investigation into Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. As earnings season for banks gets underway, JPMorgan Chase (JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon stated that "anything that chips away" at the Fed's independence "is probably not a great idea." Allspring Global Investments chief investment strategist for fixed income George Bory and New Century Advisors chief economist Claudia Sahm — alongside BMO Capital Markets' Jennifer Lee — examine how Fed officials are expected to react to these headlines. Sahm also served as a Federal Reserve Board economist and is the creator of the central bank's Sahm Rule recession indicator. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Fed expected to 'stick to the mandate' amid DOJ investigation
content.description:
President Trump's Department of Justice (DOJ) has launched a criminal investigation into Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. As earnings season for banks gets underway, JPMorgan Chase (JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon stated that "anything that chips away" at the Fed's independence "is probably not a great idea."

Allspring Global Investments chief investment strategist for fixed income George Bory and New Century Advisors chief economist Claudia Sahm — alongside BMO Capital Markets' Jennifer Lee — examine how Fed officials are expected to react to these headlines.

Sahm also served as a Federal Reserve Board economist and is the creator of the central bank's Sahm Rule recession indicator.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Allspring Global Investments chief investment strategist for fixed income George Bory and New Century Advisors chief economist Claudia Sahm — alongside BMO Capital Markets' Jennifer Lee — examine how Fed officials are expected to react to these headlines. headline: Bank of New York Mellon Stock Rises After Earnings Beat. What Wall Street Is Saying.
summary: Bank of New York Mellon  stock rose Tuesday after the company beat quarterly earnings expectations but projected a slowdown in growth in 2026.  The bank reported adjusted earnings of $2.08 a share for the fourth quarter, surpassing analysts’ consensus estimate of $1.99, according to FactSet.  Shares climbed 1.3% to $122.17 on Tuesday after falling in premarket trading.

Shares climbed 1.3% to $122.17 on Tuesday after falling in premarket trading.
